job_title: Surgical Tech in Burlingame, CA
pros: The people I work with are amazing.  The evening shift is a tight group of highly experienced and efficient people.  We have decent health benefits but you must stay in network.
cons: Low pay.  Retirement only matches $300 a year and pension is minuscule.  During a mass exodus management adds more managers when staff all leave. Low morale. No 10 or 12 hour shifts. They provide scrubs but many staff break out from them and no alternative is provided.  Day shift staff are mostly travelers and brand new nurses or techs in training.  New nurses leave as soon as they are trained.  No preceptor pay for nurses or techs.  11-7 shift is the worst, you do all the harder cases.  Staff not equally accountable, some don't like ortho or vascular so they don't have to do their share.  Others work harder to make up for it.  No accountability.  Also, we do not recycle AND our manager made us get rid of the mission box and throw out any wasted supplies.  Most of us are applying elsewhere.

review_title: Used to be a great company
job_title: Analyst in Mather, CA
pros: Pay is somewhat competitive.  Insurance premiums are low.
cons: Too many reorganizations. Major problems with C suite and Leadership knowing how to lead. Clinical leaders can't agree on anything. Ever changing, and inefficient processes. No interest in retention of knowledgeable long term employees.  Retirement package pales compared to other healthcare organizations in the area.

job_title: Clinical Lab Assistant in Livermore, CA
pros: Absolutely none, no sense of jobs security.
cons:
This laboratory is managed very poorly by people that completely lack professionalism, ethics, and honesty.

Union has been petitioned twice under the same management team. They hold meetings and promise to listen and engage, but once the union threat is over everything goes back to the same or worse.

If you are in the management team, you can get away with pretty much anything.

examples:

If you’re in a position of powers you can sexually harass females and still have your job with a simple slap on the wrist.

Management harasses employeeson a daily basis, make up stories to get them in trouble with no evidence and they get supported by Human Resources.

Human Resources is there for management AND all that "he said she said", and "gossip" what a joke!

One Management member you cant understand anything he says. He will tell you what to do, and that is what IT is. He will always be right, do not give any suggestions his are always the best, he will not let you talk, he will argue with you if you disagree on anything. 

Another management member hates people, hates her job, will run specimens even if its the wrong media or past stability, just to pocket the money and not fight with any doctors or affiliates. Bad business.  more concerned with "controlling" employees than standing for Sutter's values or quality.

Another management memeber a complete is ignorant and I don’t know for life of me how she got the leadership position with a GED and no professional medical license, not even a phlebotomy license. Makes me wonder why the shared lab is always in trouble with government agencies and most of other Sutter affiliates. 

This place is mainly women. They hire a few men here and there. I guess they figure its easier to "control" women versus men.

There are cameras in every department, and not just ONE, two , three, four, they want EVERY angle of you, its not like you're handling money. They are even in the break rooms. The truth is they are trying to "control" as the Micro manager says, another Union scare. This is against the law.

Employees are terrified and terrorized by management and HR on a daily bases to keep their mouths shut, not so does why they’re told even if it’s against healthcare laws rules and regulations. 

They don't want you to leave your department, and are constantly enforcing no cell phones. They have a point, but this is again to control you ....This is because they don't want the Union to come back, they figure Cameras and creating a hostile work environment should do it. Don't communicate with no one. no phones, and even monitor the break room.

Sutter Share Lab is under investigation by Center of Medicare and Medicaid services (CMS), College of American pathologists (CAP), and Clinical Laboratory Improvement Amendments (CLIA)  currently. The reason......, management needs to go. Bad business, they are more busy attacking their own employees than addressing real issues with QC, patients samples and so forth, The executive director is aware, but she is no help, she also supports management, she is biased. WHAT A SHAME of management team!! so pitiful.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Sutter, CA
pros: Good benefits and flexible schedule
cons: They can only cancel travel nurses 3 times then they have to cancel their own staff which is not good if your new. You get cancelled a lot.  Some of the doctors have attitudes and are not very professional. Not the best doctor nurse relationship.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Sacramento, CA
pros: Pay was very good-can't complain there
cons:
No growth path (only promoting those with no education or experience - seen multiple times)
Work/Life balance is NON-EXISTENT
Lots of politics 
Lots of stressed out people
Department cover ups

job_title: PSR-II in Murray, UT
pros:
Pay
Growth
Culture 
This is a really great place to work and if you have medical history even better
cons: The cons about this job. Well there aren't many other than Parking in the Murray building location.

job_title: in Modesto, CA
pros: There have been several quality staff members I have met, who subsequently left, that were some of the best in the industry! Sadly, due to the reasons outlined below, staff retention of quality individuals, is an issue.
cons: Terrible leadership, unqualified staff that don't pull their own weight and despite management acknowledging the issues, nothing is done and these sub-par staff members are allowed to retain employment without retribution. Leadership is not credible.

job_title: CPT1 in Auburn, CA
pros: Sutter has so many great reasons to work for them. Medical Benefits, Top pay, Family/Work balance, Tuition Reimbursement, and many more.
cons: Upper management really doesn't take employees opinions on what works or not serious enough.

job_title: Quality Specialist in Sacramento, CA
pros:
Management that cares. 
Transparent executive leadership. 
Flexible schedule. 
Very accommodating of the "work/life" balance. 
Room for growth since the company is expanding.
cons:
No permanent or partial with from home positions.
Training in certain areas could be improved.
Manual processes that need to be updated.

job_title: Senior Project Manager in Mather, CA
pros: Compensation, benefits, not much else
cons: Extreme micromanagement, Poor work life balance, inefficient, no formal process or structure, lots of dysfunction and poor morale

review_title: Sutter Health is a decent company to work for.
job_title: Administrative Assistant in Sacramento, CA
pros: Flexibility in scheduling.  Some very good people working there.  Emphasis on continuing education.
cons: Lots of politics.  Those not in a position of management are not treating with respect at times.

job_title: Deposit Services in Sacramento, CA
pros: They provide a structured training process, reasonable pay, and benefits.
cons: It's hard to network within the company to obtain cross training and building multiple skills. Managers seem to have a lot of social politics that interfere with the employees advancement opportunities.

job_title: Management in Sacramento, CA
pros: Decent pay, nice coworkers, some good training, tries to be patient centered, major employer
cons: SMF is currently losing lots of senior management staff due to frustration of not being able to effectively make change.  Also appears to be some budget woes.  Lots of duplications across the systems, aging doctor's and some negative office staff members.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Murray, UT
pros: Great working environment. Leaders are very flexible and helpful. Big learning curve for new entrants
cons: Delayed in pay raise. Not all departments have dual language compensation. Holiday work hours are not always great. not all locations provide transportation for workplace. Mondays are required business days, difficult to get off if sick etc.

job_title: Staff RN Emergency Room in Novato, CA
pros: Close-knit group to work well as a team, organized, evidence based practice, management encourages career advancement, supportive of time off, pays well, management is approachable, patients are easy to work with, doctors are intelligent and also approachable
cons: Too focused on customer service over true nursing practice, not enough overtime availability, recently--lots of staff turnover to the city and to Kaiser

job_title: Unit Clerk in Novato, CA
pros: I don't have very many positive things to say about Sutter health, but here it goes, Competitive pay and benefits, convenient locations.
cons: Lack of leadership and communication, surprisingly driven by a profit motive (Interesting see how this is non-profit, organization)  Very little upward mobility.

job_title: in San Mateo, CA
pros: Great benefits including the retirement plan and also the 401k plan.  When starting full time I was worried about the plan but during my pregnancy I have had not to pay anything
cons: When taking leave it would be nice if the reps helped out more. They just think we know everything.  Sometimes it takes a full week to get a hold of the rep

job_title: Pharmacy Technician in Sacramento, CA
pros: Good hours, benefits and flexible time off. Easy to work with management. Flexible hours and easy to take time off
cons: Holiday, sick leave, and vacation time all combined into one Paid time off bank. pay is not up to par due to non profit organization

job_title: Intake Coordinator in San Francisco, CA
pros: The employees their are great, friendly and very helpful. Made some wonderful friends there.
cons: Commuting is horrible but the people are wonderful

job_title: Business Development in Milpitas, CA
pros: Pension &  great ancillary benefits.  Over all really great people who work as physicians and medical staff.  The “suits” in the organization. She follow more of their lead.
cons: Medical coverage only allows you to use their providers.  A lot of red tape in this organization and right hand often doesn’t know the left hand and what they are doing.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Sacramento, CA
pros: Sutter Medical Foundation is a great company that prides itself in putting quality patient care first. The benifits are great.
cons: Although the pay is good, I think it could be more competitive with other Health Care companies in the market. Employees are expected to work outside of their scope of practice and take on more responsibility without more pay.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Berkeley, CA
pros: Great pay, work with some great nurses on the floor.
cons: There is a big divide between people who work on the units and administrative folks and managers who seem to not be as aware as to day to day happenings and needs on the unit.

job_title: Member Service Representative in Murray, UT
pros: Decent health care and opportunity to work from home.
cons: Working in a call center. Callers are often upset or irritated with the fact that they have an HMO. Issues can sometimes be very serious and complicated, and it's hard to not take these cases home with you.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in North Sacramento, CA
pros: This company values their employees. I worked there for 4 years and loved it in the Finance department. Every month they would select an employee of the month and recognized your hard work.
cons: The con is that work can be monotonous. Also there is a lack of training. You need to be proactive and self sufficient to get work done.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Mather, CA
pros: Some truly amazing and wonderful people work for this company, but none are in leadership positions.  Genuinely good and talented people leave the company all the time, for no other reason than disgust unfortunately.
cons: Management is sadistic, corrupt, and contemptuous of employees.  My department experienced a turn-over rate of around 30% every year.  With few exceptions, each person left in utter disgust - several just walked out without another job secured.  I will never work for a company this evil again.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Antioch, CA
pros: Based upon SEIU Union- Full Medical, Dental & Vision coverage free for you + Family, Paid time off, Sick leave and some retirement. Easy to move around within the company once your in (ie if you start in housekeeping and become an RN or Xray tech you have first priority on jobs)
cons: Nothing major, occasionally upper management doesn't appreciate some good employees.

job_title: Cash Poster in Concord, CA
pros: The direct department supervisor and manager(s) exceeded, if any,  expectations with  support, encouragement, excellent communication and conveyance of being interested in each in each position. Upon any challenges or issues, resolutions and accommodations were offered as appropriate.
cons: Our office/department was relocated due to mergers and banned.

review_title: why you should work at Sutter
job_title: Registered Nurse in Rocklin, CA
pros: Evidence-based practice,Supportive management and staff.The nurse educators are out to make sure that the nurse understands the process and rational for their practice
cons: Nothing so far ,I really have seen nothing wrong with this place.Some units are cliques,but that’s always expected .Some nurses are helpful,some are not.You will see this everywhere you go.

job_title: Physician in Sacramento, CA
pros: Great bunch of pediatricians but overworked.
cons: Every year complained about work ethics of the person I worked with but was never addressed. This is not the tight knit organization it claims to be . Money and profitability over run values, ethics and honesty.

job_title: in Vallejo, CA
pros: Great hospital staff community. It's a small hospital with caring nursing staff.
cons: It is a tight knit staff and it take a long time for them to accept you into their community.

job_title: Vice President in San Francisco, CA
pros: Great Northern California company. Very traditional approach to the market.
cons: Sutter is in year two of a major restructuring, with new leadership across the board, and still reliant on a hospital-centric business model.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in West Valley City, UT
pros: I absolutely love working at Sutter Health. I'm excited to get yo for work in the morning. I love the people I work with, salary is good, weekends and holidays off and holidays are paid. Benefits, flexible, and a secure job.
cons: I can't think of a con.

job_title: Operations Leader in Sacramento, CA
pros: Talented and driven care teams wanting to provide the best care for their patients. Lean tools and methodologies being deployed to help drive local initiatives and improvement.
cons: Top down management style! Limited investment dollars necessary for organic growth. Hospital-centric focus trying to shift slowly to ambulatory side of the house.

job_title: Staff RN in Auburn, CA
pros: My co-workers are lovely and there is great team work on our unit; interactions are pleasant with fellow nurses, Hospitalist, Surgeons, PT, RT, Case Managers, Environmental services, dietary, lab, transport, security etc. My manager is warm, kind, fair and approachable. In general it's a friendly, positive atmosphere to work in.
cons: I don't feel the grass is greener at other hospitals.

job_title: in Mather, CA
pros: Nice staff to work with. Lousy leadership
cons: Leadership is disconnected from the staff. Too much infighting and politics

review_title: Worked for an affiliate. Overall management was good and fair to employees. IT was ran well.
job_title: Storage Engineer in Campbell, CA
pros: Good people. Was like the Roach motel. Most checked in and don't check out. Most work was well thought out.
cons: Lack of upward mobility.  Like typical medical, slow to adopt new technologies and some "old boys club" favoritism was observed.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Modesto, CA
pros: Very nice working environment and co workers. Well paid and reasonable work schedule. Great benefits . Great protection and continuing education opportunity to the stuff.
cons: Not a lot of overtime . Non union hospital. Rental housing price around the area is ridiculous high based on the income in the town

job_title: Cyber Security in Roseville, CA
pros:
-Privacy and Information is a huge focus for Sutter Health.  
-Lots of opportunities for growth within the teams. 
-Good compensation for the area.
-Pension/403b
-Benefits - no medical premiums, low vision and dental premiums, cheap life insurance, legal assistance, EAP, etc
cons: -I wish they would fix their holiday pay and PTO usage requirement.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Sacramento, CA
pros: There are pretty decent benefits...
cons: There is a extra layer of management that provides no value whatsoever. Why pay for these people to be here when they are essentially worthless. Supervisors are over-worked and under paid. I'd never want to "supervise" at this place.

job_title: in Sacramento, CA
pros: competitive pay and benefits. There are some good Sutter doctors.  Many different facilities to choose from.
cons: Employees and managers overworked and understaffed on a regular basis. Training is limited. Management doesn't care. No one wants to take responsibility for current issues or problems.  The right hand doesn't know what the left hand is doing.

job_title: Healthcare Information Management Clerk in Sacramento, CA
pros: Good opportunity to get your foot in the door. Familiarizing yourself with different document types. Friendly atmosphere and great team to be apart of.
cons: No room to grow in the department. Very repetitive at times, communication could be better between management and staff. Also I feel favoritism plays a role in what review grades are given.

job_title: PSR II in West Valley City, UT
pros:
tuition reimbursement, good benefits, lots of room for advancement,
on site cafeteria, work from home opportunity and growing very fast
cons: Service level controls entire department, high turnover rate, management is hardly available, no team leads, projects and 1 on 1s are frequently canceled. Poor training

job_title: Patient Service Representative in West Valley City, UT
pros: bonuses for good performance, opportunities for growth, continuous training, benefits, pay, gym, café, nice work environment, employee feed-back to management annually,
cons: sometimes negative co-workers, new work processes can be stressful, initiation of new projects can be stressful and can feel not well planned sometimes

review_title: Working towards becoming one large system
job_title: Registered Nurse in San Francisco, CA
pros: Has community feel within large system.  Good benefits, good career opportunities, lots of exciting changes, large electronic health record for continuity of care for patients
cons: Shared services can be slow and disconnected. Human Resources can be slow to respond and give job offers in a timely manner

job_title: IT Analyst in Burlingame, CA
pros: Great benefits, long term employees
cons: Long term employees act like DMV employees.  Lazy workers, no extra effort to succeed in the job. They just cruise along until they retire.

job_title: Senior Talent Acquisition Consultant in Sacramento, CA
pros: The leadership and culture here at Sutter are amazing. Our leaders value our opinion, support a solid work life balance and keep the patients at the center of everything that we do regardless of how far you are removed from patient care.
cons: Some of our systems could be more efficient, but it is being addressed

job_title: Electronic Imaging Technician in Sacramento, CA
pros:
Great Pay
Decent health care Benefits
Many opportunities For growth
401k
cons:
Burnouts from being under staffed
Some dept managers can be rude

job_title: A/R II in Murray, UT
pros: Good benefits, feedback from management. Employee Work Survey yearly.
cons: Horrible raises, favoritism, No teamwork between California & Utah offices. Said would never have a call center environment? Exactly what happened. Doesn't know how to control the growth.

review_title: Very busy hospital.  Pay is ok.
job_title: Radiologic Technologist in Salida, CA
pros: Multi task, fast pace work environment with a wide variety of work load.  O.R., portables, ER, Outpatients, Inpatients and Trauma a Services.
cons: Out of date and or faulty equipment.  Including the purchase of cheap new digital portable.  No wireless on CArms, and workflow could be improved.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Sacramento, CA
pros: Great pay,  my boss really cares about me, my family,  and my future. Flexible hours and supportive of students.
cons: I really love Sutter Health but if I had to say I'd change anything it would be how PTO, sick pay and holidays all came out of the same bucket.

job_title: Billing in Salt Lake City, UT
pros: Benefits that is all I can say
cons: When you quit on good terms and ask if you are rehire able and receive an email saying you are from the Manger of the department  then you try to return and are ran around and lied to. No one gives you a straight answer

job_title: Security Officer in Roseville, CA
pros:
Welcoming employees. Very little problems on the Sutter Shared Site.
Company really looks out for it's security guards even though we are contracted through a different company. Mostly clerical work done in lobby and patrols.
cons: Nothing i would say that isn't outside of the scope of daily challenges withing the job description.
